description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

directions.1: Add cold water to your blender and start blending at a low speed.
directions.2: Add 1 scoop HMR Vanilla Shake mix to the blending water.
directions.3: Add PB2 to the shake.
directions.4: Add strawberries to the shake.
directions.5: Add ice cubes one at a time.
directions.6: Allow to blend for 1 minute and enjoy the taste of a PB and J sandwich in shake form!

description: Warm up with this cozy soup with a touch of peanut-soy sauce. A little zest and a whole lot of flavor and nutrition. A warm and satisfying soup for any meal that's simple to make! This recipe supports the Decision-free, Healthy Solutions, and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 270 calories.

ingredients.4: 1/8 tsp each- onion powder, garlic powder, chili powder, and curry powder
ingredients.6: 1 HMR Whole Grain Medley with Chicken entree

directions.1: Whisk PB2, soy sauce, and 1 Tbs water until smooth.
directions.2: Add spices and broth to mixture and heat in microwave for 1-1.5 min.
directions.3: Heat entree as directed on package.
directions.4: Combine entree and broth mixture.

description: All the flavors of your favorite candy bar with only 120 calories and tons of volume! Chocolate, caramel, and peanut butter make this decadent shake perfect for an evening treat. This recipe supports the Decision-Free, Healthy Solutions, and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 120 calories.

ingredients.5: 1 Tbsp. peanut butter sugar-free syrup or PB2 Powdered Peanut Butter

directions.1: Add ingredients to blender, and mix until smooth.

description: This Phase 2 recipe packs a protein punch! Prep this Mexican dish as a batch recipe (makes 7 cups at 190 cals per cup) to eat throughout the week. Add 1 cup to a bowl of lettuce or spinach to create an exciting new salad alternative for lunch!

ingredients.5: 1 cup roasted red pepper salsa (can use different salsa flavor based on preference)

directions.1: Prepare quinoa based on box directions.
directions.2: Preheat a large skillet over medium heat, spray with olive oil spray. Add corn and black beans. Cook until corn is tender, about 3 minutes.
directions.3: Add quinoa and cumin and stir to combine. Cook until quinoa is hot and begins to get a little crunchy, stirring constantly, about 3 minutes.
directions.4: Stir in salsa and cook until everything is combined and quinoa begins to dry out a little more, about 2 minutes.
directions.5: Remove from heat and let cool for 5 – 10 minutes.
directions.6: Garnish with fresh, chopped cilantro (optional). Serve.

description:
This recipe supports the Healthy Shakes plan, and can also be used in Phase 2. 

A creamy and filling blend of oats topped with fruit. Overnight oats are a great way to prep ahead of time and are so versatile! You can add different toppings and flavorings of your choice to enhance the flavor and add variety.

ingredients.1: 1/2 Cup old fashioned whole grain oats
ingredients.2: 1/4 Cup plain low-fat or non-fat Greek yogurt
ingredients.5: 1 Cup fruit of choice (berries, bananas, apples, etc.)

directions.1: In a small bowl, mason jar or glass container, combine oats, yogurt, almond milk, and cinnamon.
directions.2: Stir mixture to combine.
directions.3: Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
directions.4: In the morning, top with fruit of choice and enjoy either warmed up or cold.

description: A quick, easy, and convenient breakfast is perfect to make-ahead for grab-and-go mornings. Packed with protein and flavor, it'll keep you full for hours. This recipe supports the Phase 2 plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 170 calories.

ingredients.2: 1 bell pepper (any color), cored and seeded

directions.1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
directions.2: Cut the pepper in half, lengthwise, and lay the pepper, inside up, on a baking sheet.
directions.3: Spray with olive oil or cooking spray, and bake the pepper for 8 minutes.
directions.4: Take pepper halves out of oven and crack an egg into each of the pepper "cups."
directions.5: Bake for another 12 minutes.

description: This Phase 2 recipe is quick, refreshing and delicious. Serve as is or mix in other vegetables such as tomatoes, corn and onions to add even more color and texture. This is a refreshing, low calorie dish to enjoy in the warmer weather; perfect for your next BBQ! This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 3 servings, at 50 calories per cup.

ingredients.3: 3 Tbs sugar (or substitute with coconut sugar, Stevia or other sugar substitute)

directions.1: In a small bowl, mix vinegar, water, sugar and soy sauce.
directions.2: Toss cucumbers and radishes with vinegar mixture. Mix in sesame seeds and ginger.
directions.3: Serve cold.

description: When it comes to vegetables, the more colors you consume, the greater variety of antioxidants and phytochemicals your body receives. And at just 85 calories per cup, this colorful salad is low in calories, but does not skip on satisfaction. This Phase 2 recipe makes 16 cups.

ingredients.9: 4 Ounce cooked spiral pasta (OR whole wheat pasta, quinoa or couscous)
ingredients.10: 5 Tablespoon nonfat mayonnaise (OR nonfat plain Greek yogurt, hummus or guacamole.)

directions.1: Mix all ingredients together.
directions.2: Chill before serving.

description: Celebrate Cinco de Mayo with this one-pan meal! Our low-calorie Mexican inspired taco dish has just the right amount of spice and is super flavorful. Plus, it’s a healthy wholesome meal that’s simple to make. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 4 servings at 330 calories per serving.

directions.1: Preheat oven to 425. Prep baking sheet with aluminum foil and cooking spray.
directions.2: Chop veggies (sweet potato, bell pepper, and green beans) and spread evenly on baking sheet.
directions.3: Cut chicken into 4-4oz portions and place on baking sheet alongside the veggies.
directions.4: Sprinkle the veggies and chicken with the seasonings (cumin, paprika, chili powder, cilantro, salt, and pepper)
directions.5: Bake for 15-20 min and then remove chicken (be sure it is fully cooked and no longer pink inside).
directions.6: Flip veggies and bake additional 15-20 min.
directions.7: Cut chicken into slices and place chicken and veggies in taco shell and top with avocado, hot sauce, and sprinkle of lime juice.

description: Whip up this easy-to-make-ahead pudding that's perfect for a quick breakfast or snack. Chia seeds are full of nutrition and will keep you full for hours! You can get as creative as you want with toppings for a personalized meal. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 5 servings at 108 calories per serving (not including toppings).

ingredients.2: 2 Cups unsweetened almond milk (or milk of choice)
ingredients.3: Toppings of choice (fruit, honey, cinnamon, etc.)

directions.1: Add chia seeds and milk to a mason jar or glass Tupperware.
directions.2: Using a fork, whisk the chia seeds and milk together, let sit for 1-2 minutes, whisk again, then cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
directions.3: The chia seeds will absorb the liquid and become a gel-like pudding consistency.
directions.4: Add a serving of the pudding to a bowl and top with desired toppings and enjoy.

description: Cauliflower is a low-calorie vegetable that can mimic the chewy, moist texture of rice when chopped up and cooked. You can make your own using fresh cauliflower or you can purchase it pre-made in the produce or frozen food sections of most grocery stores. This Phase 2 recipe makes about 5 cups at 158 calories per cup.

directions.1: Preheat medium skillet and spray with olive oil spray.
directions.2: Add the onion and carrot to the pan, cook 3-5 minutes or until softened. Add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds.
directions.3: Season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove the vegetables from the pan, place them on a plate and cover to keep warm.
directions.4: Pour 1 tbsp. olive oil into the pan; add the eggs and cook, stirring occasionally and breaking up with a spatula until the eggs are scrambled and cooked through. Season with salt and pepper.
directions.5: Add the cauliflower rice, reserved cooked veggies and frozen peas to the pan. Stir in the soy sauce and cook until cauliflower has just softened, 4-5 minutes.
directions.6: Serve immediately, sprinkled with sliced green onions.

description: A burger without the bun! This loaded burger bowl will provide all of the flavors of your favorite dish without the added calories. Lean ground turkey topped with crispy veggies, pickles, and avocado, topped with a secret sauce. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 379 calories.

directions.1: Place a pan over medium heat and spray with cooking spray. Add ground turkey to pan and cook until no longer pink, about 8-10 min, stirring frequently. Then sprinkle with garlic powder, salt, and pepper and mix to combine.
directions.2: Assemble bowl with lettuce or spinach, cherry tomatoes, cooked sweet potato, red onion, pickles, avocado, and then top with 4oz ground turkey.
directions.3: In a small bowl, mix together the ketchup, mustard, and lemon juice. Then drizzle over burger bowl.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

ingredients.4: 1/2 Cup black beans, rinsed and drained
ingredients.5: Optional: salsa, nonfat sour cream and guacamole

directions.1: Cut enchiladas into small pieces
directions.2: Place vegetables in a casserole dish
directions.3: Stir until blended
directions.4: Place enchilada pieces on top
directions.5: Heat in microwave, covered, for 2-3 minutes

description: Craving something with crunch? Skip the chips and snack on these low-calorie, crispy veggies made with eggplant, carrots and green beans! You can even pair these crispy veggies with your favorite HMR entree or a lean protein. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 3 servings, at 95 calories each.

ingredients.4: Spices of choice (garlic, onion, paprika, basil, etc.)

directions.1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
directions.2: Chop eggplant and carrot into thin flat slices (chip-like).
directions.3: Spray a baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray. Spread eggplant slices, carrot slices, and green beans on baking sheet.
directions.4: Sprinkle veggies with spices of choice. Roast in oven for 15-22 min. Then broil for 5-7 min until crispy.
directions.5: Serve immediately.

description: Creamy warm and soothing tomato soup perfect for those colder months. Just 2 ingredients blended together for the perfect side dish or snack. Creamy tomato soup that's low in calories and full of flavor! This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 188 calories.

ingredients.2: 1 14.5 oz can Whole or Diced Tomatoes

directions.1: Place tomatoes and chicken soup packet in a blender and blend until smooth.
directions.2: Heat in microwave until warm (about 1-2 minutes).

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

directions.1: Prepare soup as a sauce according to directions on the packet.
directions.2: Heat entree according to package directions.
directions.3: Mix entree and vegetables in a large bowl.
directions.4: Stir in sauce and blend well.

description: Summertime is the perfect time to enjoy this refreshingly, light, yet creamy lemon smoothie! Made using a creamy vanilla HMR shake and blending in bright, lemon flavor. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 240 calories.

ingredients.3: 1 Tbs sugar-free lemon Jell-O pudding mix

directions.1: Add ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.

description: A simple chocolate smoothie with room for tasty add-ins. Add variety with fun toppings like sliced banana, fat-free whipped topping, or Multigrain Hot Cereal mix. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 220 calories.

ingredients.6: Optional toppings: fat-free whipped topping, dry

directions.1: Add ingredients to blender and mix until smooth.
directions.2: Add toppings of choice.

description: Taste the goodness of the garden with this soup! Made with HMR Pasta Fagioli entree, crisp green beans, satisfying cannellini beans – and, a hint of garlicy flavor. It’s a filling meal for any day of the week. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 380 calories.

directions.1: Dissolve bouillon cube in hot water.
directions.2: Place bouillon, entree, green beans, cannellini beans, and garlic powder in a microwave-safe bowl.
directions.3: Heat thoroughly.

recipe: Snow Peas and Carrots with Ginger
description: Crunch! Zing! Bring some Asian flair to your plate. This recipe works well over a bed of salad greens (try adding some mandarin orange slices too), or as a warm side. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 5 servings at 55 calories per serving.

ingredients.1: 6 oz package frozen snow peas (sugar snap peas may be substituted)
ingredients.4: salt and black pepper, to taste

directions.1: Steam or microwave snow peas and carrots until tender. Drain.
directions.2: Sprinkle on seasonings. Can be served warm or chilled.

description: Perfect summer meal filled with the HMR Chicken with Barbecue Sauce entree, fresh veggies, and topped with a zesty Italian dressing. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 425 calories.

ingredients.1: 1 HMR Chicken with Barbecue Sauce Entree
ingredients.2: 1 cooked corn on the cob, cut into two pieces

directions.1: Cook the entree according to package directions
directions.2: Combine tomato, cucumber, and onion slices
directions.3: Drizzle Italian dressing over cabbage and tomato/cucumber mixture
directions.4: Serve with corn

description: This simple, yet tasty soup is rich and zesty! You can keep this recipe simple or add your own spices, vegetables, and lean proteins. Get ahead of your busy week and make a large batch to enjoy this creamy soup all week long!  This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 4 servings at 50 calories per serving.

directions.1: Add all ingredients to a medium sauce pan and bring to a boil on the stove.
directions.2: Once boiling, turn down the heat to simmer, covered, for 15 minutes.
directions.3: Let cool, then add to a blender or use a hand blender. Blend until smooth and thick.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

ingredients.2: 1 HMR Vegetable Stew with Beef Entree

directions.1: Microwave the potatoes until soft.
directions.2: Mash the potatoes with the broth, adding butter substitute, salt, and pepper.
directions.3: Set aside.
directions.4: Pour the entree into an 8" casserole dish.
directions.5: Add the corn in one layer on top of the entree.
directions.6: Spread the mashed potatoes over the corn.
directions.7: Microwave until warm. (For a golden brown top, heat at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes.)

description: The perfect side dish or snack! Tasty sweet potatoes roasted to golden-brown perfection with a hint of rosemary spice. Just a couple of ingredients and minimal prep! This roasted rosemary sweet potato recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 4 servings at 56 calories per serving.

directions.1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Prep a baking sheet with aluminum foil and cooking spray.
directions.2: Chop sweet potato into 1 inch cubes and place evenly on baking sheet.
directions.3: Top sweet potato with salt, pepper, and rosemary and then bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway.

description: What goes better than summertime and watermelon? This lemonade watermelon blast shake! Simply blend watermelon and a hint of lemonade blended with an HMR vanilla shake and you’ll be sipping on summer. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 210 calories.

directions.1: Add ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
directions.2: Add Crystal Light Lemonade
directions.3: Add watermelon, blend
directions.4: Add ice cubes, blend thoroughly and drink!

description: This recipe is so simple and perfect for an evening fall treat! Only 2 ingredients but tons of flavor! Make a big batch for a family dessert or a single serving for yourself. You can get creative and add extra toppings or enjoy as is. Perfect for a warm autumn dessert! This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 90 calories.

ingredients.3: Toppings of choice (HMR 70 Plus pudding, non-fat frozen whipped topping, P2- almond butter, Greek yogurt)

directions.1: Slice apple into thin slices.
directions.2: Heat a small frying pan over medium-high heat and spray with cooking spray.
directions.3: Add apple slices to the pan and saute about 5 min, stirring frequently.
directions.4: Add cinnamon and stir to coat.
directions.5: Enjoy alone or with your favorite toppings.

description: Enjoy Italian night with this colorful meal. HMR Cheese and Basil Ravioli entree mixed with zucchini, yellow squash, and the perfect pinch of Italian seasoning. Simple and satisfying for any day of the week. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 280 calories.

ingredients.3: 1 HMR Cheese and Basil Ravioli Entree

directions.1: Spray a medium pan with non-stick cooking spray and place over medium-high heat. Add sliced zucchini and yellow squash and saute until tender, about 5-10 minutes.
directions.2: Add entree and seasoning to pan, mix with vegetables, and heat until warm.

description: Take this HMR Mushroom Risotto entree to the next level! Packed with colorful vegetables and bursting with flavor! This recipe is easy to make and adds a whole new twist to this entree. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 350 calories.

directions.1: Place a fry pan over medium heat and add asparagus, mushrooms, onion, and broth. Saute until asparagus is tender, about 10 min.
directions.2: Add seasonings to the vegetables and mix to combine.
directions.3: Add entree to mixture and stir until entree is heated through.
directions.4: Remove from heat and top with tomatoes.

description: Turn your next HMR shake into a smoothie bowl topped with berries or bananas (or any fruit you love) and enjoy it by the spoonful! This fab bowl recipe is a simple and fun breakfast or an anytime snack. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions, Healthy Shakes, and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipes makes 1 serving at 187 calories.

ingredients.1: 1 HMR vanilla shake or protein powder
ingredients.7: Toppings: sliced banana, berries, almond butter (P2), chia seeds (P2)

directions.1: Combine ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
directions.2: If mixture is too thick, add extra water 2 Tbs at a time.
directions.3: Add blended smoothie to a bowl. It should be thick enough to eat with a spoon.
directions.4: Top with desired toppings and enjoy!

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans. This flavorful recipe offers maximum flexibility for how you can use it: with an entrée, on a salad, as a topper for your favorites veggies (great on a baked sweet potato). Makes 5 cups at 170 calories per cup.

ingredients.1: 2 15-oz. cans black eyed peas rinsed, drained, mashed
ingredients.5: 1 medium green bell pepper, seeded and chopped

directions.1: Combine all ingredients, except salad dressing, mix well.
directions.2: Pour salad dressing over mixture, cover and marinate at least 2 hours in refrigerator.
directions.3: Drain. Serve chilled.

description: These fluffy, moist pancakes offer ample protein to keep you full all morning long in Phase 2. Pair with fresh fruit or a touch of honey for additional sweetness. Makes 7-8 pancakes; 3-4 pancakes = 1 serving.

ingredients.5: 1-2 Tbs unsweetened almond milk or skim milk

directions.1: Preheat a skillet over medium heat and coat it with cooking spray.
directions.2: Add the ingredients to a blender and process until the batter is smooth and frothy.
directions.3: Pour the batter straight from the blender onto your skillet for desired size of pancakes.
directions.4: Cook them until the edges have set and bubbles begin to form on the tops, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook for another 2 minutes.
directions.5: Repeat until all the batter is gone, making sure to coat your skillet again with cooking spray between each batch.
directions.6: Top with desired toppings (sugar-free maple syrup, fruit, etc.).

description: Let’s take pizza and give it a healthy twist! We’re replacing the traditional pizza crust with a sweet potato crust for a super smart health swap. Top this recipe with your favorite veggies or pair with a side salad and you’ve got yourself a satisfying meal that’s a slice above the usual pizza fare. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes about 6 servings (2 slices per serving) at 175 calories per serving (not including toppings).

ingredients.2: 1 Cup oat flour or almond flour
ingredients.10: Toppings of choice (marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, veggies, etc.)

directions.1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Prep a baking sheet with aluminum foil and cooking spray.
directions.2: Poke sweet potatoes with a fork or knife and microwave for 5-10 minutes.
directions.3: Once sweet potatoes are cool cut in half, scoop out the flesh and place in a medium bowl. Mash with a fork.
directions.4: Add flour, egg, apple cider vinegar, spices, and oil to the bowl with the sweet potato and mix well. (Mixture will be thick and sticky).
directions.5: Using a rubber spatula spread the sweet potato mixture evenly onto the prepped baking sheet.
directions.6: Bake for 25-30 minutes (if crust is thin, check after 20 min).
directions.7: Add desired toppings and cook for additional 5-10 min.

description: Hearty hot cereal mixed with vanilla Greek yogurt, topped with fresh fruit, and a sprinkle of chia seeds. Stay full and stay satisfied with this simple, low-calorie breakfast meal. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 310 calories.

directions.1: Empty contents of cereal packet into microwave-safe bowl. Add 3/4 cup water and stir.
directions.2: Microwave for 90 seconds, then let sit for 1-2 minutes.
directions.3: Add yogurt to cereal and stir to combine.
directions.4: Top with sliced apricot, sliced banana, and a sprinkle of flax and chia seeds.

description: A perfect mix of hearty filling grains and healthy omega 3s. Easy to make a big batch ahead of time for the whole week or breakfast for the whole family! Top this quinoa and chia bowl with your favorite toppings to make a balanced satisfying meal to start your day! This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 4 servings at 158 calories per serving.

ingredients.3: 2 Cups unsweetened almond milk (or milk or choice)
ingredients.4: Toppings of choice (banana, berries, cinnamon, vanilla extract, almond or peanut butter or PB2)

directions.1: Cook quinoa according to package (combine 1 cup dry quinoa and 2 cups of water in a medium sauce pan and place over high heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer, cover, and cook for 15 minutes).
directions.2: Once the quinoa is cooked, let it cool.
directions.3: In 1 large Tupperware or divide evenly into 2 Tupperwares or mason jars- combine 1 cup of cooked quinoa, 5 Tbs chia seeds, and 2 cups unsweetened almond milk.
directions.4: Mix with a fork, let sit for 2-3 min, then mix again. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
directions.5: When you're ready to eat, place 1 portion of the quinoa/chia mixture in a bowl and add desired toppings.

description: Enjoy the flavors of lasagna with this lower calorie recipe. A simple mix of classic Italian ingredients make up this satisfying lasagna spaghetti squash meal! This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 4 servings at 190 calories per serving.

ingredients.4: 1/2 Cup part skim shredded mozzarella cheese

directions.1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees and prep baking sheet with aluminum foil and cooking spray.
directions.2: Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds.
directions.3: Sprinkle a dash of salt and pepper on the flesh side of the spaghetti squash, then place flesh side down on baking sheet and bake for 35-40 min, until golden brown and easy to seperate flesh with a fork.
directions.4: Using a fork, scrape the flesh to pull up the strands. Add remaining ingredients and mix with stringy spaghetti squash.
directions.5: Place back in oven for about 5 minutes until cheese melts.

description: Loaded with fresh ingredients, perfectly seasoned fish, and drizzled with a creamy cilantro dressing. This meal is a perfect dinner for 1 or make a batch for the whole family! This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 348 calories.

directions.1: Spray a pan with cooking spray and place over medium heat.
directions.2: Coat the fish with the cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Then place on the pan for about 2-3 minutes on each side, till cooked through.
directions.3: To make the sauce, mix or blend the juice from 1/2 lime, cilantro, Greek yogurt, salt, and pepper.
directions.4: Place the fish, avocado, and diced tomatoes in the tacos shells, and the drizzle the sauce on top.

description: A simple homemade ice cream filled with creamy strawberry and white chocolate flavors. Perfect for a quick and easy summer dessert. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 200 calories.

ingredients.4: 3 Teaspoon sugar-free white chocolate pudding mix

directions.1: In food processor fill bottom with frozen strawberries and ice cubes.
directions.2: Blend until berries and ice are crushed into a fine snow. Scrape down sides of processor.
directions.3: Turn back on and add in water till it starts to spin again.
directions.4: Then add in shake and white chocolate pudding mix.
directions.5: Let it mix for 2-3 minutes. Then serve and enjoy.
directions.6: If you don't have a food processor still tastes great as a shake.

description: Creamy vanilla blended with refreshing strawberries make the perfect duo. 3 simple ingredients create a smooth, rich, and satisfying meal or snack. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 275 calories.

ingredients.5: 4 ice cubes (omit if using frozen fruit)

directions.1: Add ingredients to blender and mix until smooth.

description: Wake up to this fruity strawberry shake or enjoy for an afternoon pick-me-up. It's creamy, sweet, and simple with only 3 ingredients. The strawberries add a healthy nutritional punch and the diet 7 Up keeps it refreshing and filling. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 175 calories.

directions.1: Add ingredients to blender and blend until smooth

description: All the flavors of the popular Italian treat in a lower-calorie shake. Chocolate, cherries, and pistachio flavoring will satisfy any sweet tooth. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 225 calories.

ingredients.4: 1 Tbs sugar-free, fat-free pistachio pudding mix

directions.1: Add ingredients to blender and mix until smooth.

description: Get your pasta fix with a healthy twist! Loaded with flavor and low in calories, this recipe mixes spaghetti squash with the HMR Ravioli Entree for a delicious Italian dish. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 300 calories.

ingredients.7: 1 HMR Cheese and Basil Ravioli entree

directions.1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees and prep baking sheet with aluminum foil and cooking spray.
directions.2: Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds.
directions.3: Sprinkle with a dash of salt and pepper on the flesh side of the spaghetti squash, then place flesh side down on baking sheet and bake for 35-40 min, until golden brown and easy to separate flesh with a fork.
directions.4: While squash is cooking, add remaining vegetables and garlic to a non-stick pan over medium-low heat and saute until tender.
directions.5: When squash is done, use a fork to scoop out the strands of the squash and then add 2 cups of squash to the pan with the vegetables.
directions.6: Continue cooking on low heat for another 2-3 minutes.
directions.7: Add entree to pan and mix with vegetables. Heat until warm.

description: Take the HMR Chicken Pasta Parmesan entree and elevate it with a seasoned spaghetti squash. This high volume, low calorie meal will satisfy for lunch or dinner. You can even make a big batch for the whole family to enjoy! This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 350 calories.

directions.1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees and prep baking sheet with aluminum foil and cooking spray.
directions.2: Cut spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds.
directions.3: Sprinkle a dash of salt and pepper on the flesh side of the spaghetti squash, then place flesh side down on baking sheet and bake for 35-40 min, until golden brown and easy to separate flesh with a fork.
directions.4: Using a fork, scrape the flesh of the spaghetti squash to pull up the strands. Then place about 2 cups on a plate.
directions.5: Heat entree as directed on package then place over spaghetti squash and top with basil.

description: Dive into this Mexican-inspired dish packed with zesty flavors from the HMR Chicken Enchilada entree mixed with black beans, corn, and avocado! Get creative with refreshing toppings for a satisfying meal! This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions, and Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 420 calories.

ingredients.5: 1 Garnish: diced onions, non-fat sour cream, jalapenos, salsa

directions.1: Heat the enchiladas, corn, and beans separately.
directions.2: Mash the avocado with the fork.
directions.3: Plate up and eat.

description: The magic of this recipe lies in its layers! You start with a plain vanilla shake, but by the time you’re done, you’ll have a truly decadent treat that is fruity, creamy, and oh-so-delicious. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 340 calories.

directions.1: Add the vanilla shake, water, and ice to a blender and mix until smooth. Make it extra thick by adding more ice (6-8 cubes), and blending longer. Option to mix in 1 tsp. chia seeds for Phase 2.
directions.2: Spoon 1/3 of your blended vanilla shake into the bottom of the glass (keeping the remaining 2/3 of the shake in the blender).
directions.3: Add a layer of blueberries to the top of the shake in the glass (about 1/2 cup).
directions.4: Add 1/2 cup blackberries or raspberries to the remaining shake in your blender and mix until smooth.
directions.5: Spoon1/3 of the blended shake on top of the layer of blueberries in your glass, then top with a layer of sliced bananas.
directions.6: Add blueberries (about 1/3 cup) to the remaining shake left in the blender and mix until smooth.
directions.7: Spoon the rest of the shake into your glass and top it off with remaining blueberries or raspberries and enjoy with a spoon!

recipe: Tuna and Vegetable Salad with Lemon-Dijon Dressing
description: Albacore tuna in water is a portion- and calorie-controlled protein that offers a lot of variety in Phase 2. Use it in your favorite salad, mix it with hummus or Greek yogurt for a healthy spread or put some on a whole wheat cracker for an afternoon pick-me-up!

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Shakes plan, and can also be used in Phase 2. Heart healthy salmon is a great base for your Healthy Plate. Note: Salmon calories can range depending on type of salmon (ex. Atlantic, Alaskan, Wild, etc.). Calories shown are for Atlantic salmon, 376 per serving. This recipe makes 4 servings.

ingredients.5: assorted garnishes: sliced oranges, minced scallions or fresh herbs

directions.2: Lightly season salmon with salt and pepper and then let it sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes.

recipe: Whole Wheat Couscous with Mushrooms and Greens
description: This recipe supports the Healthy Shakes plan, and can also be used in Phase 2. "One Bowl" meals are all the rage and this simple recipe lives up to the reputation. Start with a layer of greens, add couscous and top with sautéed mushrooms and onions. Makes 2 servings at 298 calories each.

directions.1: Boil 3 cups of water, add couscous, remove from heat, cover.

directions.4: Salt and pepper to taste.
directions.5: Fluff couscous in pan.
directions.6: Layer greens on plate, then couscous, and top with onions and mushrooms.
directions.7: ptional: Garnish with cherry tomatoes.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Shakes plan, and can also be used in Phase 2. Sunday afternoons were made for this – roasted veggies in the oven and a hot pot simmering on the stove. This recipe is worth the wait. Makes 3 servings, 245 calories each.

directions.10: Add remaining broth and additional water if needed until rice is tender.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Shakes plan, and can also be used in Phase 2. This is a cool dish for hot summer days (but can certainly be enjoyed any time of the year). directions.1: Combine all ingredients and serve chilled or room temperature.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Shakes plan, and can also be used in Phase 2. It yields about 5 cups at 140 calories per cup. Serve it as a delicious side dish for dinner or keep it in the fridge for healthy lunches throughout the week.

ingredients.11: salt and black pepper, to taste

directions.1: Cook couscous according to package directions.
directions.2: In large bowl, combine remaining ingredients with prepared couscous.
directions.3: Season with salt and pepper.

description: This dish is wonderful over a hearty spinach salad, sandwiched between fresh whole wheat buns or folded up in a crispy lettuce wrap. It's a crowd pleaser that will add variety and flavor to replace the typical burger meal in Phase 2.

description: Dig into this spicy dish at a picnic or at home. A mix of Turkey Chili, ketchup, and mustard, with a dash of spicy Tabasco. A few simple ingredients with lots of flavor. directions.1: Saute bell pepper pieces in pan in nonstick cooking spray until soft.
directions.2: In a separate bowl, mix the salsa and sour cream.
directions.3: Layer the ingredients on a plate in the following order: entree, salsa and sour cream mixture, lettuce, tomatoes, red peppers.
directions.4: Sprinkle the top with green chilies.

description: Classic spaghetti bolognese with a healthy twist. 3 simple ingredients adds tons of flavor and an easy to throw together weeknight meal. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 620 calories.

ingredients.3: 1 15 oz. can Hunts fire roasted diced tomatoes with garlic

directions.1: Cut the squash in half lengthwise.
directions.2: Scoop out the seeds in the center.
directions.3: Place the halves in a casserole dish, cut side down.
directions.4: Add about 1/4 cup water to dish.
directions.5: Cover dish with plastic wrap.
directions.6: Microwave for 10 to 12 minutes until soft.
directions.7: Carefully remove each half and using a fork, rake the pulp to make spaghetti like strands.
directions.9: Cut up HMR Lasagna into bite sized Pieces.
directions.10: Mix lasagna and tomatoes together and heat.
directions.11: Top spaghetti squash with the sauce and enjoy

description: This lasagna is packed with colorful veggies and full of flavor. Just a few simple ingredients heated for 10 minutes and dinner is served! This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 375 calories.

ingredients.2: 1.00 Cup frozen spinach, thawed and drained

directions.1: Cook and drain spinach according to package directions
directions.2: Squeeze excess water from spinach
directions.3: Layer spinach, tomatoes (reserving ¼ cup), mushrooms, and entree (if using fresh mushrooms, first saute in pan with non-stick cooking spray)
directions.4: Microwave 2-3 minutes until heated
directions.5: Top with remaining tomatoes

description: This recipe supports the Decision-Free plan, and can also be used with all HMR plans.

directions.1: Blend water on low speed.  Loosen blender cap to allow steam to escape.
directions.2: Add soup mix and entree slowly and continue to blend for 1-2 minutes.
directions.3: Add amount of buffalo sauce of your choice.  I like mine very spicy!
directions.4: After blending is done, pour into a soup bowl and microwave for 1 minute.

description: It's always pumpkin spice latte season with this delicious recipe! A burst of pumpkin and vanilla flavors. This shake is perfect for the morning rush or an afternoon pick-me-up. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 165 calories.

directions.1: In a saucepan over medium heat, combine vanilla shake, water, pumpkin, coffee, and Splenda.
directions.2: Cook until steaming, stirring frequently.
directions.3: Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and pumpkin pie spice. Whisk well (or use immersion blender).
directions.4: Top with fat-free whipped topping and cinnamon (optional)

description: Dive into a warm fall-inspired breakfast with this Orchard Hot Cereal. A delicious mix of fresh apples and HMR Multigrain cereal. This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions, and Phase 2 diet plans. This recipe makes 1 serving at 310 calories.

ingredients.3: 1 fresh apple, cored, cut into bite-sized chunks

directions.1: Add Multigrain Hot Cereal packet, water, and cut apple pieces to a bowl and mix to combine.
directions.2: Microwave for 90 seconds and then allow to sit for 1-2 minutes to thicken up.
directions.3: Sprinkle with cinnamon.

description: A lightened up tuna salad is perfect for lunch. Creamy avocado is a great substitute for mayo and makes this meal filling and flavorful. Serve this over a salad, vegetables, or toast. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 116 calories.

directions.1: In a bowl, mash the avocado with a fork.
directions.2: Add remaining ingredients and mix together.
directions.3: Serve on cucumber slices, toast, bell peppers or over a salad.

description: Creamy buffalo chicken stuffed into taco shells offers a new twist for taco night. Add fresh veggies for a balanced and satisfying meal. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 4 servings at 330 calories per serving.

ingredients.9: 4 Tbs crumbled goat cheese (or cheese of choice)

directions.1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees and prep a baking sheet with aluminum foil and cooking spray.
directions.2: Place chicken on baking sheet and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake about 25-30 min, until fully cooked and no longer pink inside.
directions.3: Shred chicken and place in a bowl with Greek yogurt, hot sauce, and garlic powder. Mix to combine.
directions.4: Fill taco shells with shredded buffalo chicken, sliced avocado, sliced bell pepper, spinach, and crumbled cheese.

description: Get out of your breakfast rut with this refreshing toast combo. Creamy almond butter topped with fresh berries, crushed pecans, and a drizzle of honey. The perfect blend of creamy and crunchy with a touch of sweetness. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 247 calories.

ingredients.7: dash of salt (if nut butter is unsalted)

directions.1: Spread almond butter on toast. Add sliced berries.
directions.2: Drizzle with a small amount of honey or maple syrup. Then top with crumbled pecans, sprinkle of cinnamon, and dash of salt

description: Fresh spiralized zucchini tossed in a light pesto sauce, perfect for any lunch or dinner. With a little added protein from the chicken topped with savory mushrooms, this meal will keep your taste buds and your hunger satisfied for hours. This recipe supports the Phase 2 diet plan. This recipe makes 1 serving at 355 calories.

directions.1: Place a large pan over medium heat and spray with cooking spray.
directions.2: Add mushrooms and cook about 3-5 min.
directions.3: Add zucchini noodles, cooked chicken, and pesto. Stir to combine and heat until warm, about 2-4 min.

description: Lettuce wraps are a crunchy and light alternative to the typical sandwich or salad or perfect for an afternoon snack in Phase 2. The protein from the salmon and Greek yogurt will not only make your taste buds happy, but will leave you feeling full and satisfied!

ingredients.1: 1 pouch StarKist Pink Salmon in water
ingredients.2: 1 container nonfat Greek yogurt (5.3 oz, 80-100 calories)
ingredients.7: Romaine or Boston lettuce leaves, washed and dried, for wraps

directions.1: Place all ingredients into a small bowl and mix.
directions.2: Add about 2 tbsp. of salmon salad in 1 leaf of lettuce and wrap.
directions.3: Continue making wraps until all of the salmon salad is used.

recipe: Whole Wheat Linguine with Cherry Tomatoes
description: This easy, fresh and simple dish is perfect for a quick nutritious meal in Phase 2. For additional variety and texture, you can substitute the whole wheat linguine with whole wheat penne or rotini noodles. Makes 12 cups at 160 calories per cup.

ingredients.7: 3/4 Cup fresh basil, chopped OR 2 tbsp. dried basil
ingredients.8: Salt and black pepper, to taste

directions.1: Cook whole wheat linguine 7-9 minutes, or as package recommends, and drain. Pour into a shallow bowl.
directions.2: In 12" skillet, add oil and sauté garlic, hot pepper and onion over high heat until onions are lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
directions.3: Add tomatoes, basil, salt and pepper, stir until tomatoes are hot, about 2 minutes. Pour over linguine and serve.

description: This delicious Phase 2 dish can also be personalized to make it your own. Add in some baby spinach or kale. Make it spicy with a bit of hot sauce or red pepper flakes. Substitute whole wheat pasta or quinoa in place of the rice. Makes 8 cups at 170 per cup.

ingredients.7: 1 Cup uncooked short grain brown rice
ingredients.9: 1 Cup chicken or turkey (white meat, skinless, cooked, diced)
ingredients.10: 10 Ounce package frozen artichoke hears, thawed

directions.1: Spray 12" frying pan with nonstick spray. Over high heat, cook red pepper and zucchini until tender (but still crisp), about 5 minutes. Put vegetables aside in a bowl.
directions.2: Add onion, garlic, salt and pepper to pan, stirring over medium heat until onion is golden.
directions.3: Add rice and stir until it looks opaque and milky, about 10 minutes. Add broth, stirring occasionally, until rice boils.
directions.4: Adjust heat to a simmer. Cook uncovered for 30 minutes.
directions.5: Stir in artichoke hearts, chicken and vegetables. Reduce heat to low and cook until most liquid is absorbed, 10-15 minutes.
directions.6: If liquid is absorbed and rice is not done, add more broth until rice is cooked through.
directions.7: Remove from heat. Top with parmesan cheese and serve.

description: Don’t let shrimp be a rare treat! Use this low calorie, protein packed, Phase 2 recipe to enhance your salads or lay it over vegetables and rice (or grain of your choice). Makes 10 cups at 65 calories per cup.

ingredients.2: 2 red bell peppers, cut into strips
ingredients.3: 2 green bell peppers, cut into strips
ingredients.4: 2 yellow bell peppers, cut into strips
ingredients.7: 1/2 Cup fresh cilantro, chopped (parsley can be substituted)

directions.1: Bring chicken broth to a boil in a large nonstick skillet.
directions.2: Add all the ingredients, except shrimp and lime, and stir-fry for 7 minutes over medium heat.
directions.3: Add shrimp and stir until they are pink and opaque, about 4 minutes.
directions.4: Serve with fresh squeezed lime.

description: It’s no surprise that lean protein and vegetables are low in fat and calories. They can also keep you feeling full and satisfied in Phase 2. This is a win-win when it comes to weight management! Makes 10 cups at 160 calories per cup.

ingredients.3: 1/2 lb. boneless chicken breast, sliced into thin strips
ingredients.7: 2 large yellow or red bell peppers, quartered

directions.1: Cook pasta according to package directions and drain.
directions.2: Spray a skillet with nonstick spray. Heat over medium-high heat.
directions.3: Season chicken with salt and pepper, then add chicken, mushrooms, peppers and eggplant to pan.
directions.4: In a small jar, shake oil, vinegar and mustard until blended.
directions.5: In a large serving bowl, toss arugula with chicken and vegetables. Can be served warm or chilled.

description: This Phase 2 recipe puts a sweet spin on the pasta dish.  Add grilled shrimp or chicken to ramp up the protein and provide a complete meal that includes grains, lean protein, fruit and vegetables! Makes 9 cups at 125 calories per cup.

ingredients.1: 3 Cup uncooked rotini pasta (OR whole wheat pasta, brown rice or quinoa)
ingredients.3: 20 Ounce chunk pineapple, drained, saving ¼ cup juice
ingredients.7: 1/2 Cup low fat Italian salad dressing

directions.1: Cook the pasta according to package directions. Drain and cool. Put into a large bowl.
directions.2: Add peas, pineapple (but not juice), carrots, cucumbers and peppers.
directions.3: In a small bowl mix together the salad dressing, parsley and pineapple juice. Toss with the veggies and pineapple.
directions.4: Chill and serve.

description: Wake up your taste buds when you cozy up to a bowl of this chili! This recipe melds the creamy taste of pumpkin with rich chili spice for a super satisfying dish. Want protein? You got it - garbanzo and black beans in this chili bring protein to the party. Double or triple this recipe at the beginning of the week to enjoy all week long. It’s a super filling dish that can be served as your main course, but feel free to enjoy as a warm pick-me-up throughout the day. You can mix in corn, peas or acorn squash if you’re looking for more texture and variety. Bonus, it’s vegetarian….vegetarians love chili too! This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan and can also be used for the Healthy Shakes plan and Phase 2. This recipe makes 5 servings, at 189 calories each.

directions.1: In a large pot over medium heat, sautee diced onion and garlic for about 5 minutes until onion is soft and translucent.
directions.2: Once onion and garlic are cooked, add remaining ingredients to the pot.
directions.3: Bring to a boil. Reduce to simmer, stir well, then cook on low heat for 20 minutes.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

ingredients.3: 1 Granny Smith Apple, cored and diced

directions.1: In a non-stick pan sprayed with Pam, sautee the onions until soft.
directions.2: Add the apples and cinnamon and sautee for 2 to 3 minutes, until the apples are soft but still hold their shape.
directions.3: Stir in the Risotto and Amaretto sugar-free syrup. Heat through.

description: This Phase 2 dish offers a great way to sneak more fruit servings into your day. Share with your family and friends for a colorful, fresh, fun warm-weather meal. Recipe makes 4 servings, at approximately 95 calories each.

directions.1: Lightly spray the fruit with non-stick spray, grill until lilghtly charred on both sides.
directions.2: Cook the couscous in the broth according to package directions.
directions.3: Mix the green onions, cilantro, lime juice, salt and pepper.
directions.4: Chop the grilled fruit and mix with the cooled couscous.
directions.5: Toss with the onion mixture.
directions.6: Serve at room temperature or chilled.

description: The combination of sweet and salty flavors makes this a satisfying dinner option any day of the week in Phase 2. Pairs nicely with oven-roasted vegetables or a frozen vegetable medley, if you are crunched for time. Recipe makes 4 servings, at 220 calories each.

ingredients.3: 2 Cup riced broccoli (or other riced vegetable)

directions.1: Heat a saucepan over medium-high heat.
directions.2: Saute ground turkey until cooked thoroughly (until pink color is gone), stirring frequently.
directions.3: Once ground turkey is cooked create a well in the center of the meat and pour in the liquid egg whites.
directions.4: Cook egg whites for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently.
directions.5: Once egg whites are cooked, add riced broccoli, soy sauce, honey, and spices.
directions.6: Stir everything to combine.
directions.7: Lower heat to low, cover, and let sit for 2 minutes.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

directions.1: Prepare HMR 70 Plus Vanilla pudding as instructed on the packet.
directions.2: Stir the syrup into pudding.
directions.3: Sprinkle diced apple with cinnamon. Cover and cook in microwave until soft.
directions.4: Top warm, cooked apple with pudding mixture and enjoy!

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

directions.1: Place 8 ice cubes in a food processor fitted with a metal blade.
directions.2: Process ice until finely ground.
directions.3: Scrape ice down.
directions.4: Add pumpkin, shake mix, spices, pudding, and sweetener.
directions.5: Process for 2 -4 minutes or until it becomes a soft “ice cream” texture.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

directions.1: Pour water into a blender.
directions.2: Begin mixing on lowest speed.
directions.3: While blender is on, add shake mix, sweetener, flavorings, and banana.
directions.4: Blend for 10 seconds.
directions.5: Gradually add ice cubes, one at a time, replacing the blender cover after adding each ice cube.
directions.6: Continue blending until smooth.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans.

ingredients.1: 2 HMR Turkey Chili with Beans Entree
ingredients.2: 1 15 oz. can diced tomatoes with or without jalapenos

directions.1: Place all ingredients in 2 qt. or larger pan.
directions.2: Allow to heat through on medium setting then simmer on low 15 minutes or more.
directions.3: Serve with a dollop of fat-free sour cream.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans. Light and refreshing, this warm weather recipe also delivers a lot of flavor. Try it with grilled vegetables for a satisfying summer meal.

ingredients.1: 2 Cup seedless watermelon (rind removed), cut into ¾ inch cubes
ingredients.4: 1/4 Cup fresh basil leaves, cut into thin ribbons

directions.1: Toss everything together. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

description: This recipe supports the Healthy Solutions plan, and can also be used with Healthy Shakes and Phase 2 plans. If you’re from the South, you’re probably already familiar with this staple (it’s actually a tradition to make and eat it on New Year’s Day for good luck in the new year). This version is low in calories and high in nutrition and flavor!

ingredients.7: salt and black pepper, to taste

directions.1: Simmer the garlic, onions and bell pepper in broth until soft.
directions.2: Add the black eyed peas.
directions.3: Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
directions.4: When warm, stir in the green onions.

description: This recipe supports the Decision-Free plan, and can also be used with all HMR plans.

directions.1: Pour a packet of HMR 70 Plus Vanilla mix into a small bowl along with sugar-free banana pudding and add about 1/4 cup room-temperature water.
directions.2: Mix into pudding and set aside.
directions.3: Add 3/4 cup hot water to HMR Multigrain Hot Cereal, mix, and let sit for 1-2 minutes.
directions.4: Add sugar-free cinnamon brown-sugar syrup to cereal and stir.
directions.5: Lastly pour cooked cereal into pudding bowl and mix well. Top with cinnamon.

description: This recipe supports the Decision-Free plan, and can also be used with all HMR plans.

directions.1: Pour cold water into a blender. Cover blender and start blending on low speed.
directions.2: Add the HMR Vanilla Shake mix.
directions.3: Add ice cubes, one at a time, replacing the blender cover after adding each ice cube.
directions.4: Add the spices.
directions.5: Continue mixing until ice is thoroughly blended.
